office: North Bay Democratic Member of Congress

working a flexible schedule including long hours, nights and weekends
performing other duties as assigned

strong academic credentials required

thoroughness and careful attention to detail
ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment in fulfillment of casework responsibilities
knowledge of office policies, practices, procedures, and computer applications

key_responsibilities: ensuring that the legislative staff is properly focused on carrying out the Member's legislative goals and works to formulate positions on legislative issues

monitoring legislative activity on the House floor and handling long-term and short-term legislative planning for the Member and overseeing the progression of bills with which the Member is involved as they move from Committee to the floor
recommending strategies and tactics on bills and positions

assigning legislative staff areas of responsibility, monitoring and evaluating the work of legislative staff, training and supervising legislative staff, and ensuring that legislative staff complies with office policies, practices, and procedures
scheduling and directing legislative staff meetings and meets with groups of constituents or other office visitors, as necessary

recommending co-sponsorships of legislation to the Member, writing and reviewing legislative memos, and recommending hiring of legislative staff, with approval of the Chief of Staff and the Member, when necessary

coordinating responses to all legislative mail and assisting organizations and constituents in the District with federal matters
maintaining a good working relationship with the Member, staff and constituents and accepting performance-based criticism
working a flexible schedule including long hours, nights, and weekends and meeting attendance requirements as established by the office
working well under pressure and handling stress
performing other duties as assigned

strong academic credentials
graduate degree preferred

thorough knowledge of Members’ Congressional Handbook and House Rules

knowledge of office computer applications including proficiency in Microsoft Word, Power Point, Access, and Excel
